messages.message:
For some NLP-related things, I’m going to need to call `save` and `load` functions that — because they are built into SpaCy — will want to touch local disk….. The objects that need to be saved and loaded will be between 10mb and 1gb spread across a directory…

Here is what I was thinking — was curious to hear your thoughts:

1. Make `with temp_folder_from_instabase_fs` python wrapper that downloads a folder from instabase into a `tmp` folder and, when the scope closes, removes the folder
2. Make `with temp_folder_to_instabase_fs` python wrapper that creates an empty temp folder and, when the scope closes, uploads the folder to instabase and then removes the folder
